The Great Architect
Ghazi Laghmani has asked for any possible assistance in finding her teacher, the Great Sage Imhotep, last seen near The Acropolis.
“Imhotep the Wise?”
The Great Sage of Brimstone! Oldest living soul on Aeternum, friend to the Ancients, architect of the Great Pyramid at Akhet! \n\nHe is more valuable than the Library at Alexandria!
“Sounds like a living treasure.”

He’s also committed to stopping the Corrupted Legion. If anyone can do it, it’s him. \n\nBut he’s gone missing. He does this occasionally. Well, frequently, actually, but this time I feel something terrible has happened!
“You want me to search for him?”
Am I that transparent? You’d be doing Brimstone Sands a great service. \n\nHe was traveling to The Acropolis and was supposed to send word when he arrived. But it never came. Start your search there.
Have you found any sign of the Great Sage Imhotep? \n\nWe desperately need his wisdom.
You’ve returned! To be honest, I wasn't sure if you would. What’s this? A journal page? \n\nImhotep took Aban with him! He’s a fellow scribe and dear friend. Where could they have gone?
“The journal page didn't say.”
I must find out! But there’s a looming crisis we must deal with first. \n\nI hope I'm not becoming a burden but heroes are hard to find.
Search for Imhotep within {POITags}
Search for any signs of Imhotep
Follow the trail of the discarded Legion equipment
Find the path to climb and reach the journal page
Read the journal entry, 'A Mysterious Threat'
Your bold and effective defense of these refugees has enraged the Legion garrison at Crassus’s Rise. \n\nThey’re preparing a massive assault to wipe us all out.
Preemptive Strike

Ghazi has received word that the Corrupted Legion is preparing an even larger assault on the Caravan. While she heads north to search for Imhotep, she has asked you to attack the Legion directly at their garrison of Crassus's Rise.
“So this is an actual Roman Legion?”

Noticed that, did you? They’re the original Romans who founded New Corsica centuries ago. \n\nThey were once Brimstone’s noble protectors. But after a terrible tragedy, Corruption turned them into a scourge.
“It’s always Corruption, isn’t it?”
Don't get me started! It has been a blight on this land for thousands of years. \n\nIt was a plague even to the Ancients when they walked these sands. It unleashed a terrible cataclysm.
“Is that why the Ancients are gone?”

Your guess is as good as mine. Not even Imhotep knows. But let's focus on the matter at hand! \n\nThe Legion fortress lies to the west. Hit it hard. I’ll try and pick up Imhotep’s trail. I'll meet you outside the fortress. Good luck!
If you thin the ranks at the Legion garrison, that might take the fight out of those vicious brutes. \n\nAnd believe me, they have it coming.

I was hoping to see your striking visage again! And your aura of confidence has grown. That can only mean victory, yes? Well done! \n\nThe Corrupted Legion will think twice before attacking innocent refugees again.
“Back to finding Imhotep?”
You read my mind, you wily oracle! \n\nImhotep's wisdom may be the only thing that can save us from this relentless foe. I pray he’s safe and sound.
Strike the Legion at {POITags} to prevent the attack on Wikala al-Waha
Burn the Legion's war supplies
Defeat {targetName}

string.comment: Default Dialogue & Gives MSQ: Stirring in the Sands
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: Luckily, my efforts to locate Imhotep have borne fruit! Aban sent a message that they were heading to Carthago. \n\nAban seemed especially worried about our master losing himself…
Stirring in the Sands
Imhotep continues to investigate a new threat, heading west toward Carthago. Once found, Ghazi anxiously awaits news of his return at Cavalier's Rest.
“What exactly does that mean?”

I’m afraid it’s… complicated. You see, when someone lives as long as Imhotep, their mind can become full and sometimes spill, like a vessel holding too much water. \n\nThoughts, ideas, they can all become jumbled.
“Are you saying Imhotep is mad?”
No, he’s not! His mind has simply had to contend with so much. Centuries and centuries of memories. \n\nWe were never meant to live this long. Imhotep has said so on many occasions.
“Is he reliable?”

Of course! He holds more knowledge than anyone else in the world. We just have to be patient with him. \n\nThere's an outpost that way called Cavalier's Rest. Please, search Carthago. Find Imhotep and bring him there. I've come to rely on you. Don't let me down.
Have you searched Carthago for any signs of Imhotep and Aban? We must find them!
Please… help me… aahhh… please…
“Easy… Are you Aban?”
My master Imhotep… gone to New Rhacotis… I was to collect Ghazi… meet him there… \n\nI didn’t see them… didn’t hear them…
“Didn’t hear who?”
Those things! *cough* Those horrible things… \n\nYou must warn Imhotep… the sands… have come alive…
You’ve returned! By Isis, you're tougher than old crocodile leather. \n\nBut your look is so grim. I’m afraid to ask…
“No Imhotep, just a dying Aban.”
Oh no, my poor, sweet Aban! \n\nWhat happened to him? Did he say anything?
“He said the sands came alive.”
What the hell does that mean? And what’s this? Another journal page? \n\nOh my dear master! What could’ve befallen him? Damn my eyes, I should’ve been by his side!
Read the journal entry, 'The Malevolence Grows'
Continue following Imhotep's trail into {POITags}
Search Carthago for any signs of Imhotep
Locate the speaker in distress
Assault the Lost Bandits in Carthago:
Defeat {targetName}
Descend to the Carthago docks
Defeat {targetName}
Follow Aban's instructions and continue on toward {POITags}
Investigate the temple for signs of Imhotep
Eliminate the threats within New Rhacotis
Search New Rhacotis for Imhotep's whereabouts
Follow the northern road out of New Rhacotis
Survive the ambush by the Angry Earth

string.comment: Default Dialogue & Gives MSQ: A Blossoming Threat
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: I knew something had gone wrong! I’m cursed with an infallible instinct for these sorts of things. \n\nDid you discover anything else in New Rhacotis?
A Blossoming Threat

With the ambush by the Angry Earth, Ghazi is certain they are responsible for Imhotep's disappearance. She knows the Angry Earth have been seen around Jupiter's Grove, and asks again for your continued help in finding Imhotep.
“The Angry Earth were there.”
Angry Earth? They must have attacked Imhotep. I’ve never heard of them wandering that far.\n\nWhat could they have wanted? There are few Angry Earth here and they normally gather at Jupiter’s Grove.
“Sounds like I should go there next.”
Oh, I'm really developing an affection for you! Go and see what you can find. I'll head to New Corsica to see what I can find. \n\nI feel terrible about sweet Aban's fate...
(Blank Space)
Well, you certainly seem to have stirred up this hornet’s nest, youngster! \n\nSadly, I find myself a prisoner of these elemental beings or else I’d offer my assistance.
“If you’re Imhotep, I’m looking for you.”
Then this is a fortuitous day for us both for I am he! \n\nThere’s a sandy monstrosity that seems to have a way to release these unusual bonds. But I doubt it’ll simply hand it over.
Brilliantly done, youngster! I could tell by your show of martial prowess that you are highly trained. \n\nNow, let me guess – Ghazi sent you. Am I right?
“Yes, she's headed to New Corsica.”
Remarkable woman! A brilliant mind for one so young. \n\nBut we mustn’t waste any time. Something evil stirs in the sands. I’ll meet you both in New Corsica. There’s much to do!
You made it! You're becoming as reliable as the dawn! \n\nImhotep arrived a short while ago. He was quite impressed with his gallant rescuer.
“I was only following your lead.”

string.comment: May edit if we do turn-in in Library.
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: Oh, I could kiss your striking visage! Repeatedly! \n\nThankfully Imhotep was still in one piece.
Search for Imhotep among the Angry Earth in {POITags}
Search for the captive Imhotep in {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} and collect the {itemName} to free Imhotep
Return to Imhotep and free him
Destroy the exposed nodules of the driftwood cage
Seek out Ghazi and Imhotep in New Corsica

string.comment: Default Dialogue & Gives MSQ - Past Prologue
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: Please excuse the mess. Most of the important books and scrolls in the city were seized and stored here. \n\nIt’s become our library and our sanctum.
Past Prologue
While Imhotep recuperates from his recent tribulations, Ghazi has suggested you read Imhotep's 'Legacy of the Ancients' and learn of the impact the Ancients had on Brimstone Sands.
“Who seized the books?”

The Pontifex Charmion, a spiritual leader here for many years. She was once very wise, but she’s lost her way. \n\nUnfortunately, New Corsica has suffered under her guidance. Guard your words carefully in her presence.
“Where’s Imhotep?”
He’s recovering from his ordeal. Although relatively unharmed, it had a greater impact on him than he was willing to say. \n\nHe’s taking restorative elixirs to help him focus his mind.
“How did he seem to you?”
I’ve never seen him so troubled. Honestly, it scares me. \n\nOh, he wanted you to consult a scroll. He said it would shed light on our current situation. It’s just there on the table.
Have you looked at Imhotep’s scroll? I think you’ll find it illuminating.
Ah, my skilled and cunning rescuer! Ghazi has regaled me with accounts of your valorous deeds. I found them most engaging! \n\nHave you read the scroll?
“I have so many questions.”
I would imagine so. But I’m afraid those must wait for now. \n\nThere is grim work ahead and much to do!
Read the tome, 'Legacy of the Ancients'
I have a feeling matters are about to get far more complicated. And not in a good way. \n\nI certainly hope we're both ready.

string.comment: Default Dialogue & Gives MSQ: Watering the Seed
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: SageImhotep

resources.string: As Ghazi noted, the Angry Earth has not been a significant force here for hundreds of years. \n\nTheir fearsome presence has multiplied by a significant factor recently. That never happens by chance.
Watering the Seed

Recovered from his kidnapping, the Great Sage Imhotep has told you of the strange seed carried north by the Angry Earth, likely to the Oasis Spontanea. He and Ghazi will await you at the Great Shrine of Thoth.
“Why did they capture you?”
A most excellent question! It’s one I have no answer for… yet. \n\nBut while captive, I saw them take a seed from the azoth tree and feed it vast quantities of life energy.
“Are they growing another azoth tree?”

An excellent guess. But why? I doubt it means something salubrious for humanity. \n\nThey carried the seed away to parts unknown. However, it will require a steady source of water. That’s rare in a desert…
“Is there an oasis nearby?”

Hmm? Oh, yes! Excellently reasoned! The Oasis Spontanea would provide such an aqueous bounty. \n\nGo there and investigate. We will meet you at the Great Shrine of Thoth. Together, we will solve this conundrum!
Have you been to the Oasis Spontanea? \n\nWe must discover what nefarious scheme the Angry Earth is seeding.

string.comment: Ghazi incomplete text during first half of 'Watering the Seed'
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: I've been to the Oasis Spontanea. It contains both beauty and danger. \n\nOut here, that particular combination is relatively common.

string.comment: Default Dialogue & TalkTo - Great Shrine of Thoth
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: I'll never forget your help in rescuing Imhotep. I’m in your debt. \n\nAlthough Imhotep's putting on a brave face, I still have worries. He's a tough old buzzard but even he has limits.
“How's his mind holding up?”
It appears stable… for now. But I will watch him closely. \n\nSomething's still amiss. And my instincts are rarely wrong, remember? It can happen but it's as rare as an eclipse.
“I like your confidence.”

It gives me little comfort. Take Aban, for example. He’s not returned. And I knew he wouldn't. Whatever killed him terrified him enough to prevent his resurrection. \n\nI can’t imagine poor Aban as a Lost…
“You two were close?”

He was like a brother. I remember when he came to Imhotep, seeking to learn. He seemed so frail. \n\nImhotep turned him away, but I changed his mind. Aban had the soul of an explorer. I hope he can forgive me...
Ah, there you are! No doubt you’ve witnessed all manner of fascinating events and faced innumerable perils. \n\nAnd bearing gifts, I see! What is that device?
“It was feeding the seed pod.”
Feeding, you say? Most intriguing. \n\nThis will certainly merit further study. Hmm, yes, most intriguing indeed…
Investigate the {POITags} for clues to the Angry Earth
Search the ruins for signs of the Angry Earth
Destroy the Angry Earth Power Sources:
East Ancient Pylon
North Ancient Pylon
Southwest Ancient Pylon
Collect the {itemName}
Meet Ghazi and Imhotep at the Shrine of Thoth

string.comment: Default Dialogue & gives MSQ: Unraveling the Mystery
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: SageImhotep

resources.string: This device is of Ancient make. I recognize the distinctive markings and construction. It’s a focus for some kind of power. \n\nBut I’ve never seen one exactly like this before.
Imhotep knows many arcane spells and secrets. \n\nHis mastery of Ancient magic is unrivaled on Aeternum.
Unraveling the Mystery

Unable to breach the magic of the Ancient focus, Imhotep knows of a powerful spell which may provide answers. Relics from Aqua Anuket, Arit-en-Geb, and Anhur's Pride should empower his magic enough to succeed.
“I still can't believe you knew the Ancients.”
Oh, I knew them. Well enough to worry about a device like this. \n\nIt’s protected by an arcane lock that prevents me from discerning its nature. I’ve encountered such locks before.
“I’m guessing you can open it?”

That remains to be seen. This one seems especially complex. The design is familiar, though… \n\nFortunately, I happen to know a spell that can open Ancient locks. But I will require certain rare components.
“You have a list?”
Hah! Your eagerness and acumen are commendable. You remind me of Ghazi. \n\nHere is the list of components and where to acquire them. I’d warn you of the danger, but I believe you’re up to the task.
Have you collected the components I need to unlock the Ancient device? \n\nThe sooner we can discover its purpose, the sooner we can counter the Angry Earth’s sinister plot.

These items are fine specimens. You have an eye for this sort of work, youngster. \n\nPlace the items in the conjuring circle in the areas I’ve marked. Then for your safety, step away. I shall begin the incantation.
“Is this Ancient magic?”

It is indeed. A sorcery taught to me by one of the Ancients themselves. My mentor. \n\nIt isn’t what we thought, by the way. The Ancients. They were not gods. Though they wielded power as if they were.
“What were they like?”
Too much like us in some ways. And yet not enough like us in others. The specter of Aeternum is their legacy. Never forget that. \n\nBut now I must concentrate. Stay close to Ghazi.

string.comment: Default Dialogue & TalkTo - Great Shrine of Thoth
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: You may witness all manner of sanity-bending events in Imhotep's presence. \n\nHe knows ancient secrets and magics that have not been witnessed by anyone for millennia.
“I'm not easily rattled.”
Yes, I noticed. You're as solid as the firmament. \n\nAnd I thank Isis for that.

Imhotep! I have been freed from the sands! Our masters grant us their power! The Ancient fires will be rekindled! \n\nYou will wither! Your flesh food for worms! Ravenous Death will have her feast! Hahaha!
Imhotep! I have been freed from the sands! Our masters grant us their power! The Ancient fires will be rekindled!
You will wither! Your flesh food for worms! Ravenous Death will have her feast! Hahaha!

string.comment: Default Dialogue & TalkTo - Great Shrine of Thoth
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: Oh gods, it’s happened! Just as I feared it would! \n\nHis state of mind was far more fragile than he had let on. My poor master…
“What’s going on, Ghazi?”
Imhotep's mind has shifted. The gentle soul of the Great Sage is gone. \n\nAnother has arisen in his place…
“He’s the ‘Great Pharaoh’ now?”
Yes, we stand in the presence of the Great Pharaoh Imhotep, Son of Ptah, High Priest of Heliopolis. \n\nWe must speak to him accordingly. We must not stress him further.
No, this cannot be! The demon has been unleashed. After all these centuries... \n\nThe nightmare takes shape once again. This will be our doom!
“What was that thing?”
No! No, no, NO! I must do something... I must stop him! \n\nArgh! My mind darkens… I drown in shadows… I am lost… LOST! ARGH!!!
“Imhotep, are you alright?”
Address me as ‘Great Pharaoh.’ That demon is Apophis, and his presence proves our dilemma is most dire. \n\nYou will defeat this nightmare. I appoint you to this task. You will become my Sword.
Search the Ruins at {POITags}
Ascend to the top of {POITags} to find the {itemName}
Collect the {itemName} from {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} for the {itemName}
Collect the Artifacts for Imhotep's Ritual:
Climb to the top of {POITags} and search for a Canopic Jar
Explore {POITags} and search for a Canopic Jar
Search the Ruins at {POITags} for an Ancient Key
Unlock the Sealed Coffer to Collect the {itemName}
Place the Horus Jar for the ritual
Place the Uraeus Jar for the ritual
Place the Ancient Seal for the ritual
Step away and allow Imhotep to begin the Ritual
Observe the Ritual

string.comment: Default Dialogue & Gives MSQ: Accursed Alchemy
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: SageImhotep

resources.string: Apophis is a Primordial, one of the powerful elders of the Angry Earth. I had believed him banished long ago. \n\nHis return can only mean destruction. Possibly even another Great Purge.
We must attend to the words of the Great Pharaoh. \n\nI know he seems different, but he's still Imhotep and wise beyond measure.
Accursed Apophis

Apophis's remarks have Imhotep worried about a grander machination involving Ancient technology. He suggests investigating an undisturbed Ancient vault in Hermopolis, where Apophis may have found materials for his plans, while he and Ghazi return to New Corsica.
“That sounds ominous.”

The Ancients awakened the Angry Earth to battle Corruption. But their deadly weapon perceived us as a threat as well. \n\nMillennia ago, Apophis led the Angry Earth in a campaign of genocide against my people.
“Glad to see it failed, Great Pharaoh.”

Only because they ceased their attacks and returned to the earth. What power compelled their retreat is unknown. \n\nBut the demon has returned, spewing disturbing words of rekindling the Ancient fires.
“What does that mean?”

It could mean calamity but we must know for certain. We may find answers in an Ancient vault in Hermopolis. \n\nYou must find a way to access it. I do not have that knowledge. When done, meet us in New Corsica.
Go to Hermopolis and find a way to access the Ancient vault. \n\nWe must discover Apophis’s plan before it’s too late.
Being named the Great Pharaoh's Sword is an immense honor. He seems to have complete confidence in you. \n\nIf we are careful and make use of his will and determination, we may yet prevail here.
“I won't let him down.”
I know the vault the Great Pharaoh speaks of, but I've never ventured there myself. \n\nIt’s a cursed place filled with dark secrets and the specters of a violent past.
“You sure Imhotep’s okay?”
The Great Pharaoh may seem different, but he’s still Imhotep the Wise. He and Apophis were enemies, which makes us his allies. \n\nStay safe, and I'll see you in New Corsica.
My mighty Sword returns! You shine with the light of Ra. \n\nWhat mysteries have you uncovered in the vault? Speak to your pharaoh!
“Some scrolls and this disgusting thing.”
These scrolls are written in Ancient script. There are few in Aeternum who can read them. I am one of them. \n\nAnd that strange jar. Something floats within…
“It’s a hand.”
So it is. I must decipher these scrolls. \n\nThere is foul alchemy at work here.
Search the ruins of {POITags} for the Entrance to the Ancient Vault
Investigate the Ancient architecture for the Entrance to the Ancient Vault
Continue searching for any clues about the Ancient Vault
Input the correct glyph sequence, then use the Actuator
Use the Platform to access the Ancient Vault
Search the Vault for evidence of Apophis's greater plan
Collect {itemName} for Imhotep to translate
Take the strange {itemName}
Meet Ghazi and Imhotep at the Library in New Corsica
The Great Pharaoh is relying on you. Oh, who am I kidding? I'm relying on you. \n\nI don’t think we could’ve chosen a better champion. That's not too much pressure, is it?

string.comment: Default Dialogue - New Corsica (2) & gives MSQ: The Demon's Cauldron
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: SageImhotep

resources.string: The scrolls speak of a process that combines the bodies and souls of different creatures together into a chimera. \n\nThis is the blasphemous power that the Ancients used to create the Primordials.
The Pools of Orcus are a foul place. The fumes there sicken even the heartiest of individuals. \n\nTread carefully, Sword of Imhotep. The less time spent there, the better.
The Demon's Cauldron

Imhotep's translation speaks of a method to merge two beings together, a practice thought long lost. The sulfurous jar indicates a visit to the Pools of Orcus to the west, and he asks your help in searching for clues to Apophis's plans.
“Someone’s making Primordials?”
I did not think it possible. But perhaps I was mistaken. \n\nThis strange jar is not centuries old, it’s new. Someone recently visited the vault.
“Apophis?”
I do not think so. Such craft seems beyond that demon’s temperament and skill. \n\nThere’s another mind at work here. One that is far more cunning.
“Command your Sword, Great Pharaoh.”

I recognize the pungent scent and sickly color of the jar’s fluid. It comes from the sulfurous Pools of Orcus. \n\nGo there and see what you can discover. But be on your guard. A great evil lurks in the shadows.
Have you been to the Pools of Orcus? \n\nWe must know what manner of abomination Apophis is creating.
The Pools of Orcus are a foul place. The fumes there sicken even the heartiest of individuals. \n\nTread carefully, Sword of Imhotep. The less time spent there, the better.
“How’s Imhotep holding up?”

Honestly, I’m worried. I’ve made more elixir, which helps to control his affliction. \n\nI fear Imhotep's formula is not strong enough. I could potentially devise a new one but my alchemy skills are not the equal of his.
“I have faith in you, Ghazi.”
And I have faith in you. You remind me of someone I knew, long ago. Another brave and noble soul. \n\nTogether, we will win the day.
Is there no task that you cannot accomplish? Ptah has crafted me a very fine weapon indeed. \n\nBut I sense something strange, a familiar power…
“It’s probably this fragment.”
It’s a piece of a Disk of Atum! It pulses with quintessence, a potent energy from the stars the Ancients used in their magics. \n\nWhy was this at the Pools of Orcus?
“There were bizarre monsters there.”
Could Apophis simply be creating an army of chimeras? That would take time. And it seems too simple a stratagem. \n\nThere is more here that we are not seeing.
Seek out the source of the sulfurous fluid in the {POITags}
Search for clues near the bubbling pools
Continue searching the pools for anything out of place
Search the remaining pools for any evidence of Apophis' involvement
Use the Azoth Staff to drain the barrier's energy
Destroy the crystal core
Collect an {itemName} from the rubble
Return to the Library to report on your findings
This mystery becomes more frightening with every step. \n\nI can't imagine where it's leading us, but my instinct tells me it's a terrifying place.

string.comment: Gives MSQ: Power of the Gods
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: SageImhotep

resources.string: The Disks of Atum were used to focus the quintessence harnessed by the Ennead, a vast power source housed within the Great Pyramid of Akhet. \n\nA structure I built for the Ancients long ago.
Power of the Ancients

Imhotep is intimately familiar with the fragment of the Ancient power source, having designed the Pyramid of Akhet to house it. He suggests searching near Diospolis for an entry point to the pyramid's interior, the origin of the fragment.
“What does it do?”

When active, it powered the Ancients’ great machines throughout the island. Hm. Apophis did boast he had been granted power. \n\nAkhet houses both wonders and horrors. It has weapons capable of terrible devastation.
“Maybe he’s after those.”
They would certainly suit that demon’s lust for destruction. And it's clear he’s been to the pyramid. \n\nMy Sword must investigate Akhet to determine if the flow of quintessence has increased.
“How will I do that, Great Pharaoh?”

I’ll enhance your azoth staff to detect the precious energy. \n\nSeek out the Diospolis entrance to the pyramid. It’ll give you the access to the inner workings of the temple, to its deepest secrets. Go with the light of Ra!
Find your way into Akhet via the Diospolis entrance. \n\nWe must know what Apophis intends to do with the Ennead’s power.
So you intend to enter Akhet? Imhotep built the great pyramid. \n\nWhatever happened there, it was enough to ensure he would never return. The Corrupted Legion seeks to claim its power.
“Why am I not surprised?”
Many have coveted the Ennead's dangerous power over the centuries. And they’ve been punished as a result. \n\nPlease be careful in there.

I'm not sure why you've come here. You cannot stop what I have begun.

The threat of Corruption was dire, but the toll you exacted from the Motherwell, the damage you wrought... it will take generations to heal.

I foolishly came to the aid of humanity, and once again, this is how we were repaid.

It is proven again, Humanity is the true source of all evils, a vessel for Corruption, a plague to nature, and you are a prime example.

Another of my kind lies dreaming in these sands, but he will soon be awakened.

And together, we will purge this island of your kind and restore Aeternum to the paradise it was meant to be. Begone from here. There is nothing you can do.

string.comment: Broken out for subtitles from Akhet_Adiana line
string.speaker: Adiana Theron
string.name: AdianaTheron

resources.string: Begone from here. There is nothing you can do.
Even here, I sensed the surge of power from Akhet! The earth hums with the energized blood flowing through her veins. \n\nWhat has Apophis done?
“It wasn’t Apophis, it was Adiana.”

Adiana...? It has been many long centuries since I heard that name. I thought her gone, like the others. \n\nYou do realize she assumes that name only to masquerade in human form? She is an Ancient we knew as Artemis.
"Wait. Adiana is an Ancient?? Artemis?"

Ah, so she keeps that a secret these days, does she? There is much significance to that fact, much I will need to consider.\n\nBut if she has reactivated the Ennead, then she has something quite catastrophic in mind.
“She's also awakening "another of her kind"?"

Here? In Brimstone Sands? She could only mean… Sutekh, the very Ancient who taught me the mysteries of Aeternum. \n\nMy... master will return then! But Artemis will need the Eye of Horus… only the Eye can awaken my master…
Search for the Diospolis entrance to the Pyramid of Akhet
Enter the Pyramid of Akhet
Defeat the {targetName} in the depths of the Pyramid
Climb the broken staircase to the upper level of the Pyramid
Search for the disturbance on the upper terrace
Listen to Adiana
Use Your Azoth Staff to unseal the Glyph
Read the Ancient Glyph "AMBA"
I must find the Eye of Horus… yes, the Eye is the key… yes, that is the only way…

string.comment: Gives MSQ: Scourge of Aeon Madness
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: The revelation of Sutekh's return has pushed Imhotep's mind to the edge! \n\nIf we lose him, we are truly doomed!
Scourge of Aeon Madness

Adiana's revelation at the pyramid has caused Imhotep's Aeon Madness to assert itself, and Ghazi has asked for help in gathering local herbs needed to treat the Great Sage. She will attempt to calm Imhotep while you prepare the recipe.
“What happened to his elixir?”
I devised a more potent formula but I’ve run out of the materials to create it. \n\nI don't even know if it'll work. But I can't leave his side. Not now!
“Give me the list, Ghazi.”
I have it here, along with the formula! \n\nPlease prepare it and return as quickly as possible. I’ll try and keep Imhotep calm. I can see he’s barely hanging on.
Imhotep's mind teeters on the edge! We need the improved elixir to heal him!
“How do we fight gods, Ghazi?”
Imhotep says the Ancients are not gods! Not in the sense that we think of them, anyway. \n\nBut I share your concern, for there is no doubt they wield power like gods.
When he returns, we will suffer his wrath! He will punish us! \n\nI must intercede! I must save the people!
“Your Sword is here, Great Pharaoh.”
I am no pharaoh! I am the Keeper of Mysteries, Guardian of Secrets, Steward of Dreams! \n\nI obey the masters in all things… I am but a humble servant...
“I see…”
The Lord of the Red Land will awaken… His wisdom and power are vast… \n\nThis need not be our ruin… this could this be our salvation!
Oh great Osiris! Imhotep is gone!
“What do you mean gone?”
He started ranting about saving us! He raced out the door! I couldn’t stop him! \n\nI was going to go after him but I knew it was wiser to wait for your return. I'm no warrior.
Gather the ingredients to create Imhotep's Remedy
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}s north of New Corsica
Gather {itemName}s from the {POITags}
Search chests in {POITags} for {itemName}
Gather {itemName} from Cacti throughout Brimstone Sands
Craft Imhotep's Remedy at an Arcane Repository or Campsite
Imhotep’s obsessed with Sutekh’s return! He kept insisting he had to "prepare the way!" \n\nI’ve never seen him like this! He called himself the “Vizier of the Ancients!”
The Eye of Horus
Ghazi's concern at Imhotep's flight is evident, and she begs your assistance in chasing him down. He ran toward the Gates of Sutekh, ranting about the Eye of Horus and the return of the gods.
“You did the right thing. Where did he go?”
He must be headed to the Gates of Sutekh. They lie to the west. \n\nMany believe that site to be both cursed and sacred. Imhotep's looking for the Eye of Horus.
“What is this Eye?”
I’ve never seen it, but Imhotep’s mentioned it a few times. \n\nIt’s a key of some kind. Whatever it is, if Imhotep wants it so badly, it’s vital that we find it first!
“What if Imhotep is too far gone?”
You have the new elixir! Perhaps it can soothe Imhotep’s raging mind. \n\nWhatever happens, please remember that the good, gentle man is still there. You just have to find him again!
Go to the Gates of Sutekh. Imhotep is there searching for the Eye of Horus. \n\nYou must find it before he does!
Retrieve the Eye of Horus! Use your staff! Track its potent quintessence!
“Imhotep?”
I’m with you… I’ll guide you if I can… Go, quickly!
Follow Imhotep to the {POITags}
Investigate the strange energy source on the wall
Adjust the position of the projector
Rotate the reflectors to project the beam of azoth forward
Investigate the building indicated by the beam
Pass through the Ancient Glyph door and explore the sealed chamber
(The chest is empty. The Eye of Horus is gone.)
Challenging the Pharaoh
The Eye of Horus has been taken, but droplets of quintessence form a path to follow. Imhotep, or perhaps something worse, must be at the end of the trail.
You are making a grave mistake! You do not understand what is happening here! Leave now and pray for Sutekh’s mercy!
You are making a grave mistake! You do not understand what is happening here!
Leave now and pray for Sutekh’s mercy!
I do not wish to hurt you! Abandon this course of action! I will stop you if I must!
I was mistaken! The Ancients are gods! We must appeal to their benevolence! Go back!
Ghazi needs you! Return and protect her! She is far more than she seems! I beg you to see reason!
This is your last warning! I will unleash the fury of the Ancients! Don’t force my hand! I beg you!
Witness the power of the Ancients! Feel their wrath!
I am the Keeper of Mysteries! Guardian of Secrets!
Even you cannot stand against the Ancients! \n\nStop fighting me!
End this pointless battle! Join me! \n\nYou can aid my efforts to appease the gods!
Aeternum belongs to the Ancients! Let them reclaim it! \n\nIt has been nothing but a curse on our people!

string.comment: Default Dialogue & TalkTo - Place of Pillars (after combat)
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: SageImhotep

resources.string: I am lost in darkness... \n\nThe abyss swallows me…
“Here, drink this!”
*cough* Ah, thank the Powers it’s you. Please forgive me. I was not myself. \n\nRa’s Light, this elixir is most potent. And tastes wonderfully of cinnamon. Well done!
“I need the Eye of Horus, Imhotep.”

Oh. Here, take it. It's the key to unlocking Sutekh’s Necropolis. We must hope he's not yet been reawakened. \n\nYou will also need a code to enter the Necropolis. Place the Eye on the pedestal further on. It will reveal the code.
You have the code! Excellent! Ghazi’s faith in you is not misplaced. Her instincts are never wrong. \n\nI wish she could see how she would benefit the people of New Corsica. She must stop hiding.
“What do you mean hiding?”
Nothing to be concerned over. \n\nYou have far more important matters to worry about at the moment.
Use the Azoth staff to follow Imhotep's trail
Follow Imhotep into the {POITags}
Search for a path up the pillars to reach Imhotep
Ascend the ruins to confront Imhotep
Confront Imhotep
Assist Imhotep with his injuries
Use the Eye of Horus on the Ancient Code Pillar
Read the journal entry, 'The Book of Gates'
Now that you have the code and the Eye, here is the location of Sutekh’s Necropolis. \n\nIt was hidden long ago to ensure the slumbering Ancient would not be disturbed.
A God Awakens

With the Eye of Horus in hand, Imhotep has given you the location of the Necropolis of Sutekh, the resting place of an Ancient. Adiana and Apophis must not be allowed to rouse Sutekh from his slumber!
“What happens if he wakes up?”
That must not happen! You must prevent Sutekh’s return at all costs! \n\nBut be prepared for a great battle. Apophis may already be there, and that monster’s power is terrifying.
“Are you going to be alright?”
I will be fine. Thanks to you, my dear friend. \n\nPlease come back to us. Ghazi and I have become quite fond of your striking visage. And she would be most distraught to lose another loved one.
You must stop Apophis from awakening Sutekh! \n\nAn Ancient of his power would wreak havoc on this land!
Insignificant worm! Does the presence of the master fill you with dread? With awe? \n\nHis return is inevitable!
Your kind should never have had the power of azoth! \n\nYou corrupted what was once pure!
I hunger for destruction! \n\nBut my appetite pales in comparison to humanity's gluttony!
We have suffered your presence long enough! \n\nDie, worm! Be buried by the sands! Hahaha!
My master will awaken soon! You will bear witness! \n\nPrepare to face judgement! Kneel, worm!
Impossible! Argh! You are nothing! \n\nThe masters will return! They will revoke their gifts! You will wither…

string.comment: Default Dialogue - Necropolis of Sutekh & TalkTo after combat, 'A God Awakens'
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: SageImhotep

resources.string: Blessed be the Light of Ra! I sensed the foul presence of Apophis banished to the sands! \n\nI was hoping I would not have to confront the demon myself.
“You doubted your Sword?”
I was cautiously optimistic. And you are not my sword, you are the Sword of Brimstone Sands! \n\nPlease return to New Corsica. Ghazi will be worried sick and will be delighted to see you.
“To see us, you mean.”
She’s spent far too many years looking at this weary, old face. It’s you she will be eager to see. \n\nAnd I will be glad to see the two of you reunited.
Bring your beautiful visage here and let me gaze upon you for a few moments! \n\nIt is so good to see you.
“You’ll make me blush.”
The flush of color would suit you. \n\nI knew you would do it. My instincts are never wrong, remember?
“It’s good to see you, too, Ghazi.”
I hope we’ll be seeing much more of each other. \n\n Under far less nerve-wracking circumstances.
The Sword of Brimstone returns! You have defeated a mighty demon and brought order to this land. \n\nI will be forever grateful for the great service you have done for my people.
“It was my pleasure— what should I call you?”

A fair question. I am now a reflection of all my past lives. But they are in balance, thanks to your tasty elixir. \n\nIf I am to choose a title, then I choose Imhotep the Physician, for the time has come to heal the land.
Enter the Ordeal of the Nine Gates
Complete the Ordeal of the Nine Gates
Enter the Necropolis of Sutekh and face Apophis
Defeat Apophis and prevent him from awakening Sutekh
Return to Imhotep to report your success
Return to the Library in New Corsica
I don’t know about you, but I could use a hot bath and a nice long nap. \n\nSome company would be nice as well…

string.comment: Default Dialogue & Gives MSQ: Secret in the Desert
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: SageImhotep

resources.string: I’m afraid I must ask you for one final boon. Given what you’ve done, I feel almost selfish making this request. \n\nBut I would trust only you to undertake this most important task.
Secret in the Desert
With Apophis no longer a threat, Imhotep has turned his attention to matters closer to home. He has asked assistance in recovering a precious and mysterious parcel, buried long ago.
“I’ll help if I can.”
There is a parcel I wish recovered. You may find it buried to the south, near a place sacred to Sobek. \n\nThis parcel is very precious to me. I beg you to guard it closely.
“Sounds mysterious.”
It could decide the future of New Corsica and affect the direction of all of Brimstone Sands. \n\nWhen you return with it, I shall reveal what it contains and explain everything.
Have you acquired my parcel? It contains something of great value to all of Brimstone. \n\nPlease retrieve it.

string.comment: Default Dialogue - Necropolis of Sutekh & TalkTo after combat, 'A God Awakens'
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: SageImhotep

resources.string: Ah, the precious parcel. I knew I would need this again someday. \n\nAnd now you deserve to see what it contains.
“Fancy clothes?”
Robes of state. This is the raiment of a noble ruler from a great land. \n\nThere is so much history in these threads and these jewels.
“They don’t really seem like your style.”
Hah! No, they are not. \n\nCould you return them to their owner? To Ghazi.
Perhaps we’ll get a proper library now—what’s this? \n\nWhere did you get this?
“Imhotep sent me to find it.”
I never thought I’d look upon this again… \n\nOh, Isis, why do you punish me so?
“Imhotep said it was yours.”
Imhotep! You swore a vow! Before all the gods! \n\nYou oath-breaking, old goat!
Search for the strange parcel buried at the {POITags}
Retrieve the parcel for Imhotep

string.comment: Not being used. This line is cut.
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: SageImhotep

resources.string: I vowed I would never speak your name openly. And I have not broken that vow. \n\nThis noble soul deserves to know the truth. After all we’ve gone through together. I know you believe that.
I’m sorry, I should have told you sooner. I wanted to. But I’ve been Ghazi for so long… \n\nMy actual name, the one I was given at birth, is Cleopatra.
A Queen Revealed

Ghazi's true identity has been revealed - Cleopatra VII Thea Philopater, Queen of Egypt! Her return would bring hope to the people of New Corsica, but Evandrus may have other ideas. Speak with him to determine his feelings.
“What is happening here?”
I’m sorry, I should have told you sooner. I wanted to. But I’ve been Ghazi for so long… \n\nMy actual name, the one I was given at birth, is Cleopatra.
“As in Queen Cleopatra of Egypt?”
Yes, but she died long ago. And another woman took her place. A better woman, wiser, stronger, more gentle. \n\nBesides, New Corsica has Evandrus now. The people have no need of a queen.
“Why don't I go ask Evandrus?”

No, she's being stubborn! Ghazi, it is time for you to take up the mantle of leadership and guide your people once again. \n\nEvandrus means well, but he’s young and inexperienced. He’ll need your wisdom and infallible instincts.
“Why don’t I go ask him?”
Another excellent suggestion! \n\nGo and speak with Evandrus. See what he thinks of Queen Cleopatra’s return. Assuming she consents.
“Your Highness?”
If both you and Imhotep feel this is for the best, then go. \n\nI will consider your words, though they weigh heavy on my heart.
Have you spoken to Evandrus about Queen Cleopatra’s return? \n\nHis opinion is vital to swaying Ghazi.
I am still pondering your words. There is so much to consider. \n\nI thought I had escaped the past.
Hail, Hero of New Corsica! Always good to see you. \n\nForgive me if I seem preoccupied. I am finding the business of running a city a bit overwhelming.
“Maybe I can help with that.”
I would welcome any help, my friend! \n\nI was trained in weapons, tactics, and military strategy. But I’m afraid I have little experience with politics and governing.
“What if Queen Cleopatra were to return?”
Oh gods! Such an event would be a blessing by Jupiter himself! \n\nThe wise queen of Egypt returned to her people. If only this fantasy could be made reality!
Have you spoken with Evandrus? What did he say? \n\nDo not spare my feelings. Well, maybe spare them just a little…
“Your return would be a gift from the gods.”
Did he really say that? He always was such an idealistic young man. So much like his father... \n\nHis words touch me deeply.
I have considered what you and Imhotep have said. \n\nYou both sacrificed so much for this land. It is only fair that I do the same.
The Coronation
With Evandrus's support, Cleopatra has consented to retake her position of power. Inform all of New Corsica of her return, then attend her coronation at the Royal Pavilion.
“This won’t be an easy job.”
It’s not the challenge that worries me. I’ve faced many perils in the service of Imhotep, as you have seen. \n\nI worry that I will fail my people. Again.
“Our past shouldn’t shackle us.”
You sound like Imhotep. He says our mistakes become wisdom and should strengthen us. \n\nDo you think I’d be a good queen?
“You’d be a great queen.”

You’re just biased. I still want to know how the people of New Corsica would feel about my return. \n\nCould you speak with the citizens and learn what’s in their hearts? When you’re done, meet us in the Royal Pavilion.
Have you spoken to the people? \n\nI must know how they feel about my potential return.
The Queen has returned? This is a blessing from the gods themselves!
Queen Cleopatra would certainly liven things up. I wonder if that's a good thing…
Is this a jest? It isn't? Well, I suppose she couldn't possibly make things worse.
Queen Cleopatra and Evandrus ruling side by side? You’re describing a dream!
So, what did the people have to say?
“They’re all behind you, Your Highness.”
Very well, then. I will accept this great honor from the people. \n\nThank you for being so stubborn-- uhm, I mean, for your guidance and wisdom.
"How do you feel, truly?"
I’m nervous, oddly enough. It’s been so long since I found myself in circumstances like these. \n\nFacing hordes of Angry Earth seems easier at the moment. Please stay close by.
I still can’t believe Queen Cleopatra’s alive. The city rejoices at her return! \n\nI wish my father could've been here to witness this moment.
This is a great day for Brimstone Sands, and you have made it possible. \n\nI am glad the gods led you here.
I am filled with joy! I never thought I’d live to see such a wondrous event. \n\nAnd it’s all thanks to you, my non-believer.
This is the dawning of a new day for our city and our people. \n\nThere will be great work ahead of us, but we are up to the challenge.
They said this was a land of miracles. I had begun to believe it was simply a land of nightmares. \n\nI am glad to see that I was wrong.
I still can’t believe Queen Cleopatra’s alive. The city rejoices at her return! \n\nI wish my father could've been here to witness this moment.
This is a great day for Brimstone Sands, and you have made it possible. \n\nI am glad the gods led you here.

We beseech Ra to witness this day! We call upon Cleopatra Thea Philopator, Daughter of Ptah, to be invested with the power to govern. \n\nMay she lead the people with wisdom and love. May her reign be a blessing to the land!
We beseech Ra to witness this day! We call upon Cleopatra Thea Philopator, Daughter of Ptah, to be invested with the power to govern.
May she lead the people with wisdom and love. May her reign be a blessing to the land!
There is no doubt in my mind, you were sent by the gods. You are a hero out of myth. \n\nYou will forever have an ally and friend in me.

I shall return to the library. There are still matters that require investigation. \n\nAs for you, be sure to celebrate this moment with appropriate wild abandon. If you overdo it, come see me for some herbal remedies.
Well, that’s done. Now the real work begins for us.
“Us?”
You didn’t think you were going to simply walk away into the sunset, did you? \n\nYou’re the Sword of Brimstone, remember? And I'm now the Queen of Brimstone.
“We should discuss compensation.”
Oh I'm sure we can come to some mutually beneficial arrangment. \n\nBut for now, relax and enjoy yourself. You’ve certainly earned it.
Inform the citizens of New Corsica of Cleopatra's return
Rendezvous with Ghazi and Imhotep at the Royal Pavilion
Take your position for the Coronation to begin
Observe the Coronation of New Corsica's ruler
Mingle with the notables of New Corsica
What are you doing? Didn’t your Queen command that you relax and enjoy yourself? \n\nEat, drink, dance. There's more to life than fighting monsters.

string.comment: Default Dialogue & gives MSQ: The Wild Huntress
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: SageImhotep

resources.string: It is good to see hope restored to these sands, but I must confess that I am troubled by the reactivation of the Ennead.\n\nKnowing that Artemis is involved and that she sought to raise Sutekh… it does not bode well.
The Wild Huntress

With the immediate threat stymied and Imhotep stabilized, he has recalled long forgotten memories about a shrine to Artemis somewhere in the northern reaches of Everfall. Visiting it may provide a clue to Adiana's - Artemis's - next move.
"She's planning something more."

I fear that is what the signs do clearly portend. Though Artemis was known to take human form, her hatred for our species was legendary.\n\nI am not surprised she invested much of her power in the Angry Earth, but where that leads us, I am not sure.
"Would she have an actual home somewhere?"
Hmm, the Ancients often had shrines they favored, where they received guests. \n\nI recall hearing her shrine featured a small fountain, or a well of some sort. It's likely long gone now.
"I met her at the Daughterwell."

Yes! Yes, that's it! That's the name. Go to the Daughterwell. You must! There may be answers there. \n\nBut be careful, if the wrath of an Ancient has been stirred, I pray the Light of Ra protects you. Protects us all.
Have you traveled to the Daughterwell? \n\nYou may learn more of Artemis’s true intentions.
You’ve returned! I would guess a confrontation with Artemis did not occur then?\n\nDid you learn anything more regarding her ambitions?
“She intends to end our immortality.”
Blessed Ra! An end to immortality is an end to humanity on Aeternum. \n\nIt is a Great Purge after all, the final one.
“Can she really do that?”

Great Ptah, I hope not. But I intend to find out. This will require much research. \n\nOur work continues, Sword of Brimstone. I fear we may eventually have to confront Artemis, and we will need much help if we are to do that.
Return to the {POITags} and search for answers
Search the area for any hidden markers or shrines to Artemis
Cut down the overgrown vines
Investigate the Shrine of Artemis
Return to the Library in New Corsica to warn Imhotep
Your striking visage is always welcome, Sword of Brimstone. \n\nYou make the days brighter, and the nights sweeter.
Where are you? You should have at least sent word by now… \n\nI'm sorry, friend. Something important has my attention right now. Perhaps later?

string.comment: Brimstone Unlock bestowal: Strider in the Sands
string.speaker: Tomash Kovalenko
string.name: TomashKovalenko

resources.string: You've made it! Good! Your exploits precede you, and we have need of your aid. \n\nIn addition to the threat from the Tempest's forces here, we received word that the Corrupted Legion in Brimstone Sands is preparing an assault on the capital of New Corsica. The civilians are fleeing the region in droves in advance of the fight.
Strider of the Sands

<font color="#FFC300">TERRITORY UNLOCK QUEST</font> \n\nSoulwarden Kovalenko has lost contact with an ally rendering aid to refugees. To reach him at the refugee camp, a Desert Cerate is required to survive the harsh climate of Brimstone Sands
"What can I do to help?"

Another Soulwarden, Buhawi, has been organizing the refugees, helping in any way he can. I haven't heard from him for some time. I was hoping you might check on him. \n\nBut there's an additional hurdle: the desert is impassable for anyone not adapted to its rigors.
"How can I get past it?"

From a tidbit of Yonas's knowledge, we were able to reconstruct the formula for the needed cerate. I believe... yes, this is the list of supplies he needed. \n\nBrew and apply the Desert Cerate, and it will allow you to walk the sands unscathed. Then please, find Buhawi.
My good friend Buhawi is attempting to help the people of Brimstone Sands. \n\nPlease, use the Desert Cerate to reach him and render any aid you can.

Ho there! Is that a fellow Soulwarden I see? And you've survived entry into the Sands, so the Cerate must have worked for you as well! \n\nI hope this means the residents of this place will get the assistance they need. I've done what I can, but it is far from enough.
"What can I do?"

I suggest you speak to the others in this camp, especially that young woman over there. She has been responsible for organizing much of this, and can explain the current situation. \n\nThank you again, comrade. You have brought hope where there was none.
Find the ingredients for the Desert Cerate
Gather {itemName} from eastern Shattered Mountain
Gather {itemName} from central Great Cleave
Gather {itemName} from central Ebonscale Reach
Collect Fish Oil
Mix the Desert Cerate at an Arcane Repository or Campsite
Apply the Desert Cerate to protect against the weather of Brimstone Sands
Journey to Ebonscale Reach and approach the gate to Brimstone Sands
Enter Brimstone Sands and begin the search for Soulwarden Buhawi
Cross the Deadwater Wastes
Search for Soulwarden Buhawi in {POITags}

You smell like dust and heat, friend! I assume you made it into the deserts of Brimstone Sands without too much difficulty. And Buhawi? \n\nYou've taken a weight off my shoulders! Thank you for checking up on him.

Tomash is a bit overprotective at times. Just means he cares. But helping people is what I'm meant to do, no matter the danger. \n\nCorruption, Lost, an Ancient device… doesn't matter. I am a warrior, a defender, and I will stand between the darkness and the light!

Tomash is a bit overprotective at times. Just means he cares. But helping people is what I'm meant to do, no matter the danger. 

Corruption, Lost, an Ancient device… doesn't matter. I am a warrior, a defender, and I will stand between the darkness and the light!

[You must complete the Main Story quest "A Selfless Nature" in Edengrove to access the Main Story Quests in Brimstone Sands]
It seems our work is never done. I've received word from a trusted ally named Lysandra. \n\nShe's been hearing rumors of strange tremors in the desert.
Tremors in the Sand
One of Imhotep's allies, Lysandra, has sent warning of strange events in the sands. Imhotep has asked you to seek her out and assist her in determining their cause.
"Apophis?"
By Ra's Light, let's hope not! I was hoping you could investigate. \n\nIt's impossible to know exactly what Artemis set into motion with her actions at the pyramid. This could be related.
"There are worse things than Primordials?"
The Ancients spawned all manner of terrible things in aeons past. \n\nWhen I first arrived, there were already legends of monstrous beings that once threatened the very existence of Aeternum.
"Well that's good news."
Go and speak to Lysandra. See what she knows. \n\nIf this is another one of Artemis's weapons, it's best we know it and find a way to counter it.
Have you spoken to Lysandra about those strange tremors in the desert? \n\nWe need to know what is causing them.
You found spines? Good gods... \n\nI will study these and see what I can glean.
"Any of those legends mention something like this?"
There were stories of colossal elder things that gnawed at the roots of the island. \n\nI had believed them to simply be stories.
"This place never ceases to amaze me."
It does seem to be the source of endless horrors, doesn't it? \n\nThank the gods we have heroes like you.
Aid Lysandra in her investigation of the tremors
Keep your senses honed, my friend. \n\nI may need to travel to other parts of Aeternum to gather more knowledge. We stand at the dawn of a new age…
Brimstone Sands has been my home for centuries. \n\nI refuse to leave with nothing to remember the place where I finally found love and happiness.

I tried to leave, I really did. I had every intention! When I reached this camp, my heart demanded I stop. \n\nHere in this desert, I found everything I wanted in life, and I cannot leave empty-handed.
Flower of the Sands
Collect Cactus Flowers in memory of Zahur's husband and bring them to him in the Camp.
"What is it you can't leave behind?"

The memories... of my love. Titus and I were friends for decades, but then it blossomed into something more. \n\nHe brought me flowers from the desert one day… a day I'll never forget. Now he's fallen to the Legion.
"I could collect flowers in his memory."

You… would do that for me? If I just had some cactus flowers I could preserve, I could keep my memories of Titus and what we had. \n\nYes, please. If you'll collect flowers from the cacti, I would be most grateful.
Collect {itemName} from Cacti in Brimstone Sands
My sweet Titus. I will not leave with nothing to remember him by.

Ah, you found them. Just as bright and beautiful as the day my Titus came in from the sands. \n\nNow I can leave and seek sanctuary in Oxboro. I could never repay your kindness, but take this as some small compensation.
I feel more optimistic about my journey now, free to remember the love I had… but still able to move forward.
These sands, they move… in a most unnatural way. Do you see? There! They quiver with energy. Dark days are coming…

Careful for your step, traveler. The sands, they come alive! The earth strikes back with angry vengeance! \n\nI wrote the scrolls, in my own hand, but even I had come to doubt such horrors ever existed… until now.
Sand Walkers
Defeat the Sand Walkers in The Acropolis for Tahirah.
"What changed?"

The sands…. they come to life and walk on two feet! Just like you and me! It is most unnatural! \n\nAnd if history is a lesson, these Sand Walkers tread the path of doom for us! As it was many centuries in the past.
"Can we fight them?"

We must destroy the seed from which they spring, but until then, we can strike the Walkers down where we find them. \n\nVenture into the Acropolis, brave one, and banish the Walkers back to the sands.
These Sand Walkers… they mean to replace us. I swear it. \n\nYou must strike them down!
Enter the grounds of {POITags} and destroy the Sand Walkers
Seach for and destroy Sand Walkers
Destroy {targetName}
You have returned the Walkers to the sands! Heroes like you saved us once before. \n\nGo now, seek out more of the Sand Walkers and destroy them… before they destroy us.
You may be the only hope this desert has.
The 19th Legion should be remembered with honor, with reverence, not with terror and disgust.

Know this, friend. The 19th Legion was not always dedicated to darkness. It was once the most valiant legion in all of Rome. \n\nThe 19th stayed loyal to Mark Antony even as Alexandria fell. They escorted Antony and the Queen here…
Honoring the 19th
Confiscate Pickaxes from the Corrupted 19th, and recover their Legion Insignias for Acario Clemon.
"What happened?"

It is a dark tale I do not care to dwell upon. In recent years, some of us have taken up the banner to restore the Legion's honor. \n\nThis blasphemous statue the Corrupted Legion is constructing to honor their leader, General Crassus, is a major setback
"We should stop them."

Aha, I knew you had honor the moment I saw you! Indeed, if you're venturing into the fort, it can be done. \n\nConfiscate the pickaxes to stop them from mining, and if you find any old Legion insignias, I'll reward you for them. Godspeed!
We will restore honor to the crest of the 19th Legion, no matter how long it takes.
Assault Crassus's Rise and Avenge the Honor of the 19th Legion
Defeat {targetName} to Collect {itemName}
Confiscate {itemName} from {targetName} to stop the Monument to General Crassus

I heard the clamor. It sounded like you dealt those villains a blow that'll shut them down! Well done! \n\nAnd you managed to recover some of the old insignias, as well! You are an ally if ever there was one!
"What else can we do?"
Not much more can be done here, but there are other allies in the region. \n\nLook for Tribune Alaina Kraus during your travels, I suspect she needs support as well. Invictus Aeterna, my friend!
Progress on that damned statue has really been set back after your assault. \n\nWell done, friend!
Believe it or not, our people once thought it was from this Temple that the sun was set afire each day.

Behold the glorious Lamp of Osiris, wayfarer! This sacred temple was once believed to be where the gods set the sun afire each day. \n\nThe fallacy of our faith was exposed centuries ago, but the Temple should still be ours.
On Duty, the Sun Never Sets

Once Priestess of the Lamp of Osiris, Qabalah asks you to destroy the Ancient Guardians that contol the temple and retrieve the sacred Spark of Osiris from the Lamplighter. The Lamplighter ascends the ruins at day, but descends into a hidden chamber at night.
"If not yours, who controls it?"

The Ancient Anubians, servant-constructs to the Ancients themselves. They prevent humans from trespassing. \n\nBut it was we who helped build the temple, and though it is not divine, the Spark of Osiris belongs to us.
"You want me to reclaim this artifact?"

Ah, so you aspire to walk in the steps of the heroes of old? I welcome your aid, then. \n\nStrike down the Anubians, and recover the sacred Spark of Osiris from the Lamplighter who ascends the ruins by day and goes below at night.
The Lamplighter appears above at day, but cycles into the bowels of the temple at night. \n\nThere is a way, but it is not easily seen.
Enter the {POITags} and Destroy the Ancient Anubians
Destroy Ancient Anubians
Search for and Defeat {targetName} to reclaim the sacred {itemName}

I have not seen anyone challenge the Anubians as you have in many a moon. Indeed, the spirit of the heroes of old lives on in you. \n\nYou have restored the Spark to humanity, where it belongs. Thank you.
It is a tragedy we were blocked from so many of the sacred temples we once helped to build. \n\nBut you retrived the Spark of Osiris, and that is something indeed.
If you're headed towards Jupiter's Grove, beware. The dangers of the grove have multiplied in a matter of weeks. \n\nElementals now haunt the place, and they are vengeful towards humanity.
You there, are you by chance headed into Jupiter's Grove? Are you aware of what's befallen that site? \n\nThe Grove is now overrun with Elemental entities, and I cannot get by them.
The Secret of the Baths
Thermae Alchemist Clarisse Vesta has asked you to collect Embalming Salts from the sarcophagi in Jupiter's Grove for the Roman baths in New Corsica. Deliver them to Host Habibah in the city.
"Is there anything I can help with?"
Perhaps, if you have the capacity to exercise a certain level of discretion. \n\nThis relates to the secret recipe we use to sweeten the Roman Baths in New Corsica. You have to swear to secrecy.
"Alright. I swear."

Excellent! We need embalming salts from the sarcophagii in the Grove. \n\nI know what you're thinking, but it is great for the skin. And you swore! So, get the salts, and bring the "delivery" to Host Habibah in New Corsica.
The thermae in New Corsica will soon turn foul without these salts. Please hurry!
Search {POITags} for Salts to add to the Baths in New Corsica
Search Sarcophagi and Chests in {POITags} to Collect {itemName}
Welcome to the Thermae of New Corsica, traveler, the finest in all Aeternum. \n\nI regret to say, however, that the baths are not suitable for soaking today.
"I have a "delivery" from the Grove."

Oh, then my great shame is finally to be relieved! Yes, I will take… these. Thank you very much. \n\nI would ask you to simply forget from whence these came. In exchange, a modest reward. And free soaking, for life!
Thank you for the delivery… and your discretion. \n\nFor you, the baths are complimentary!
Habibah sent word that the waters of the thermae once again restore the health of all guests to New Corsica. \n\nThank you for your help. And of course for your utmost discretion on this matter.
I am here on official Marauder business. I have no time to trifle with you. \n\nWhy don't you come back when you've got some guts!
Well met, fellow Marauder! \n\nWhat trophies have you taken lately?
Pah, you're in the wrong place. \n\nGo beg the gods for help, or whatever it is you do.
Walk back the way you came. \n\nUnless you're looking for a good fight…
Ah, the sight of you warms this old warrior's heart. \n\nKeep winning glory, for mighty Mars and the Marauders!
Begone! I have time only for those who crave knowledge. \n\nThe Syndicate keeps to our own.
Ah, excuse me, I was lost in thought. \n\nHow might the Syndicate serve you?
Spare me your misguided idealism. \n\nMy time is too valuable to waste with you.
You're looking for Commander Maximo, Marauder. \n\nMy words would be meaningless to you.
If only there were more members of the Syndicate like you. \n\nThink of all we could achieve, the vast ambitions we could realize…
Those who are truly blind cannot see even in the light. \n\nOnce you have taken the scales from your eyes and sided with the Covenant, then we may do business.
If you always give, you will always have. \n\nWhat may I give you, devotee?
Those who live by the sword will perish by it. \n\nBe on your way, Marauder.
Are you here to make amends for your hubris? \n\nLet me know if you change your mind.
You are a beacon of hope and life in these trying times. \n\nEvery deed, from the humble to the great, kindles the light in all of us.
You would be an excellent candidate for the Marauders. \n\nIf you wish to join our battles, I welcome you with open arms.
We never run out of foes to fight and victories to win. \n\nThis vicious island suits us Marauders.
You'll want Adjudicator Teos, not me. \n\nI never was much of an orator.
Talk to Alchemist Euphrosyne if you must. \n\nI never have any idea what you Syndicate are talking about.
There are no pretenses among us Marauders. \n\nYou're here for gold, battle, and glory, and I have opportunites aplenty.
Others see eternal life as a curse, but not the seekers of the Syndicate. \n\nEndless years to learn, understand, and plumb the mysteries of the world. What could be better?
Welcome, welcome. \n\nThere are enough mysteries in this land to keep both of us occupied.
We're not so different, you and I. \n\nAll you need is a little more curiosity about the light you so fervently safeguard.
Don't you ever wonder if there's more to life than battle and bloodshed? \n\nIf so, you know where to find me.
Someday, we'll rival the works of the Ancients themselves. \n\nWe will be the architects of our own paradise, right here on Aeternum.
Are you lost, friend? We all are, in one way or another. \n\nBut some of us choose to join the Covenant and find our way through the darkness, together.
We sing the song of hope on an island of strife. \n\nI know it seems a thankless task at times, but you are never alone. The light of others shines with you.
A Marauder? If you're here to pick a fight, I must decline. \n\nThis is not the time or place.
For those who claim to know so much, you Syndicate understand little. \n\nFarewell.
It's easy to give in to one's base impulses. Violence, greed, naked ambition. \n\nBut you rise above such things. You are an inspiration to us all.
You're strong, traveler, but you'd be stronger with Marauders at your side. \n\nCome on, I promise we don't bite. Much.
I've heard the wildest tales about your battles, friend. \n\nIf even half are true, you could cross blades with the legends of old!
You here for a drink? How about a fight? \n\nTch, you Covenant are all work and no play.
Hello. How's your disturbing research going? \n\nWhat? That's what the Syndicate does, right?
Having you around has really livened this place up. \n\nI hope you stay a while, friend. Our victories will be the stuff of legend!
Return when you are ready to be inducted in the arcane mysteries of the Syndicate. \n\nUntil then, we have nothing to discuss.
With each new discovery, our understanding deepens, and our power grows. \n\nThe quest never ends, fellow seeker.
Open your mind to the infinite possibilities of the cosmos. \n\nPerhaps then, we can talk.
We have nothing for you, Marauder. \n\nSeek your simple pleasures elsewhere.
The day is coming, fellow seeker. \n\nThat sublime dawn when knowledge sets us free, and mankind breaks all its shackles.
No one, no matter how strong, should be without allies. \n\nRemember that, traveler.
Welcome home, friend. \n\nThe divine calls to us with many different voices, but we of the Covenant answer as one.
Valor is nothing without a higher purpose.
Wisdom comes with compassion, not ambitious grasping.
Aeternum is a land in desperate need of hope, love, and protection. \n\nWe provide it through our service. Never doubt that, friend.
